intro: Palicourea macarthuriorum, commonly known as the MacArthur's palicourea, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many plants known for their ornamental and medicinal value. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
